title: Systems Development Engineer III, Silicon
description: Be part of a diverse team that pushes boundaries, developing custom silicon solutions that power the future of Google's direct-to-consumer products. You'll contribute to the innovation behind products loved by millions worldwide. Your expertise will shape the next generation of hardware experiences, delivering unparalleled performance, efficiency, and integration. With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a data center facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.
key_qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, an IT-related field, or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience with systems automation, and systems design and implementation. 3 years of experience with technical infrastructure (e.g., deployment, maintenance, troubleshooting).
preferred_qualifications: Experience with cloud provider ecosystems of major cloud service providers. Experience with DevOps tools such as Terraform, Puppet, Ansible, and Jenkins.
responsibilities: Ensure the timely delivery of silicon designs using Google Cloud Platform (GCP) within a fast-paced environment. Provide support, maintain, and deploy team-supported infrastructure and documentation. Collaborate closely with Engineering teams to implement and develop on Google Cloud infrastructure.
